channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Perl role with a twist in Vienna, Austria
item.description: Our client is saving the world from overpaying on electronics and household goods, one great deal at a time. As a large and trusted product and price comparison platform, these wunderkinds keep more hard-earned Euros in wallets and purses across German-speaking countries. This dynamic team is expanding into new markets, and they need a Perl programmer to help them on their way.

item.title: Thought-Leader Wanted. Chief Software Architect role in Malaysia
item.description: As Chief Software Architect for an international company providing online trading services, you’ll work closely with the Chief Technology Officer. With a strong understanding of the full stack of software development and cloud technologies, you’ll mentor engineering teams and provide guidance in solving technical issues.

item.title: Is your Python as good as your Perl? Perl/Python role in London
item.description: Our client is at the pinnacle of the premium native advertising game for corporate, tech, financial services, and lifestyle technology. This role is for a Senior Developer who is equally comfortable with Perl AND Python.

item.title: A Gem of a Perl role. Remote within UK & EU
item.description: With over 40 million readers around the globe, our client goes deep on cloud services, artificial intelligence, software, hardware, electronics, culture, and space. You’ll need experience writing great Perl, along with valid HTML, Javascript, and CSS. Toss in experience with SQL and ORMs like DBIx::Class and add your excellent Linux experience and you’ve got the skill set this role requires.

item.title: Let’s get SaaSsy! Remote Perl role within US time zone
item.description: Our client is the world’s leading provider of award-winning intelligent SaaS solutions for clients ranging from first responders and engineers to manufacturers and educators. The successful candidate is a Perl developer with Catalyst and Dblx::Class. You’ve been around the block and you know your stuff.

item.title: Boston Perl Mongers Online Meeting - topic TBD
item.description: Tuesday February 8th, 2021 07:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great CPAN modules released last week;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Weekly Challenge 149
item.description: Simon has shared not just Perl solutions but also Python as bonus. Thanks for sharing the knowledge.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge 149: Fibonacci Squares
item.description: Roger being the guy behind both tasks this week, we have got bonus material in the blog, you don't want to miss it.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 149
item.description: Luis has mastered one-liner in PDL week after week. Nice promotion of PDL. You don't want to miss it.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 149: Fibonacci and squares
item.description: Luca is another Raku champion in the team sharing lots of fun bits of Raku. Highly recommended.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 149: Fibonacci Digit Sum and Largest Square
item.description: Laurent consistently shares solutions in Perl and Raku every week. The blog quality is always the best. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge #149
item.description: James is known for compact solution. It is not easy to read though but blog makes it easy to follow. Thanks for your contributions.

item.title: PWC149 - Largest Square
item.description: Flavio presented two different approaches to solve the largest square task. Highly recommended.

item.title: PWC149 - Fibonacci Digit Sum
item.description: Flavio haa more Raku features and sharing the power of the language. Keeo it up great work.

item.title: Weekly Challenge #149 Task 2: The Terror of the Largest Square
item.description: We got bonus this week as Dave shared another blog just to share the interesting bits with regard to the largest square task. You don't want to miss it.

item.title: Weekly Challenge #149 and A Fix, Maybe, to #148
item.description: Dave has been regular blogger sharing the task analysis in great details. Keep it up great work.

item.title: That Big Ol’ Square’ll be Just Perfect
item.description: Colin surprised us with blog full of detailed task analysis sharing edge cases. Highly recommended.

item.title: When We Add Up Each Part of the Puzzle, They’re All Lies
item.description: Colin is back with exclusive blog for the task complete with interesting background story. You don't want to miss it.

item.title: CY's Take on The Weekly Challenge #149 Task 2
item.description: Cheok-Yin blog full of varieties of the same task. Enjoyable blog as always, thanks for sharing.

item.title: TWC 149: Limited Fibs, and Bases of Unusual Size
item.description: Bruce is back with compact blogging sharing Perl, Raku and C solutions.

item.title: Fibonacci Square with Raku and Perl
item.description: Thanks for sharing state variable in Raku. I wasn't aware of it earlier. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 149: Largest Square
item.description: Interesting story behing the task is shared by Abigail. Perl solution seem trivial. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 149: Fibonacci Digit Sum
item.description: Cool use of state variable to solve the task. Always something fresh in your contribution every week. Keep it up.

item.title: Perl Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 145
item.description: Perl Solutions Review by Colin Crain.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 149
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Fibonacci Digit Sum" and "Largest Square" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 150
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Fibonacci Words" and "Square-free Integer". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.description: For most people I know their disk is always full, but if you are not one of those then this advice about the /dev/full device from Su-Shee via Flavio can help.

item.title: 100 Languages Speedrun: Episode 68: Raku (Perl 6) Grammars
Perl in 2022 - A Yearly Update
item.description: It is exremly nice to see people make progress and also share it.

item.title: #549 - Wordle
item.description:
Hi there,

Probably many of you have seen people posting their wordle results. It is a nice little game that originally was written fo English speakers. Then several open source versions popped up that were then forked to create versions in many languages.

I have a partial list of Wordle clones. I was hoping the author of one of these open source versions would make it easy to add other languages and then people would not need to host their own translated versions. So far I have not seen that happen.

Anyway, this has nothing to do with Perl.

Enjoy your week!
